newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian shares gain in shortened trading session.
newsitem.headline: Estonian shares gain in shortened trading session.

text.p: Hoiupank was the biggest gainer on the Estonian bourse on Thursday in a session that was halted two-and-half hours early when the stock exchange's computer network ran into technical problems.
Total trade for the shortened session was 46.1 million kroons and the index gained 1.57 percent to 343.81. The Talse index rose 1.57 percent to 343.81.
Hoiupank gained the most to add 8.23 kroons to 199.80 kroons on turnover of 13.75 million kroons, recovering to the record levels it reached last week.
Dealers said that investors were snapping up shares ahead of its revised profit forecast.
"Selling pressure has come to an end," a dealer said.
Tallinna Pank gained 2.75 kroons to 69.95 kroons and Uhispank 0.85 kroons to 69.15 kroons.
Dealers said both stocks looked cheap compared to leading bank shares.
On the free market, industrial Norma was most active again to close 0.38 kroons higher at 88 kroons.
